I think I have probably tried each item on their menu at least once it is all excellent. aspect: menu
The wine list is wonderful and the food reminds me of my recent trip to Italy. aspect: wine list

Good Sushi, High Price aspect: Sushi
Their crab eggs benedict is addicting. aspect: crab eggs benedict

Best Indian food in L.A. aspect: Indian food
However, if you want to, drink and enjoy the pleasures of food, Sam's is your new home away from home. aspect: pleasures
I would have told the wait staff if anyone had asked me if I enjoyed my meal, but no one asked. aspect: meal
With a chef from Liguria, Italy, authentic Neapolitan brick oven pizza and one of the most impressive Italian wine lists I've ever seen, this was the real deal! aspect: brick oven

The defining characteristic of this popular restaurant, aside from dirt-cheap hot dogs, is the beverage selection, which includes a light and refreshing papaya juice, an extremely sweet pineapple juice and a sweet and frothy pina colada drink. aspect: hot dogs
The appetizer came out cold and the waiter came and took it to the kitchen. aspect: appetizer
I will be back not only because the price was so unbelievable but the atmosphere was just plain COOL and the food was spectacular. aspect: atmosphere
The food was a mix of sandwiches, salads and appetizers that were mostly healthy and had a nice Brazilian touch. aspect: mix of sandwiches
We finally flagged down another server who brought us more to drink, and then they took forever with the check. aspect: server
Got the scoop on this new hot spot and decided to give it shot for a client dinner. aspect: spot
Zippier palates share sesame-fried lobster spring rolls, shrimp dumplings with citrus soy, and inventive maki, like the smoky and sweet filet mignon-pineapple variety. aspect: lobster spring rolls

The Food The versatile Austrian menu, fused with French and American, rewards both high and low-end appetites: rich, cheese-laden onion soup, grilled Gruyere and country ham sandwiches and big-bunned burgers are as satisfying as velvety liver terrine with kumquat-cranberry compote, speck and sausage charcuterie and inexpensive cheese plates. aspect: sausage
Not including the tip for our server, who we saw twice in an hour? aspect: tip

I couple of weeks ago we went to Supper in the east village and it was so bad that we got up and left and the only way to save the evening of horrible food was to go to Blue Ribbon Bakery and have at least one thing off the menu. aspect: menu
The ambience was all wrong, the bar opened into the main dining room causing the noise to flow into the room. aspect: noise
You'll find good curry dishes and their fries (made out of sweet potato) is to die for. aspect: fries

In Short The vegi burgers (and the full bar) are the main draws: ranging from the Super Veg-Burger with lettuce, tomato and Abijah's secret sauce to the McKate (two un-beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, dairy or nondairy cheese, etc. aspect: tomato
The service can be lacking at times, but the desserts and overall experience certainly counter this flaw. aspect: desserts
The place was beautiful, I sat at the bar for two hours and eat oysters and had way too many martinis. aspect: place
Everything from the food to the service was enjoyable about this place, but I can't recommend the tempura shrimp roll with the lobster salad enough. aspect: food

Snack on a bowl of fried chickpeas while you browse the menu, then move onto the tender lamb skewers, which arrive atop a slab of French bread, perfectly poised to catch the meat's sweet drippings. aspect: lamb skewers
If you don't care about the wait staff as long as they bring you your drinks and dinner, then go to Opa. aspect: dinner
Other temptations include spumoni, tortoni, cannoli, cookies (try the pinoli), tarts and fluffy white cakes to order. aspect: cookies
We asked for bread plates when the bread was brought to the table and the server's response was management has decided not to offer bread plates. aspect: table
The pancakes were good, but don't have blueberry pancakes on the menu of you are not able to produce more than three tiny blueberries in each pancake. aspect: blueberry pancakes
Asked for wine recommendations and the waitress told me her favorites and described them in detail - I don't encounter this much in NYC. aspect: wine
With the large crowds here and the larger menu, be prepared to wait for your dinner to arrive at your table. aspect: dinner
The perfect meal; delux combo raw bar as an appetizer, King crab as your entree. aspect: bar
After being seated took our waiter 10 mintues to get us a menu, 15 minutes to come back for our order, by the time we finally got our food it was almost 1 1/2 hour since getting there. aspect: waiter

About 10 of us came here for drinks last friday, the atmosphere was good for chatting and hanging out, but not enough lounge or bar space, they should open up the back area w/ more loungable chairs or booths if they want to catch any after dinner sort of bar crowd. aspect: dinner
Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: bill
Service has improved drastically from the old days, you are now seated by a hostess instead of standing behind a nearby table waiting for them to finish. aspect: Service
The atmosphere's a bit grungy, yes, but the music and the coffee are good. aspect: music
The place was packed but we were able to get drinks at the bar w/out a problem despite the crowd. aspect: place
the service was slow took ten mins to get me a glass of water. aspect: glass
impressive balcony seating and while they forgot to give us the cold appetizers, the waiter and maitre'd more than made up for it by being most accomodating to us. aspect: seating
Only thing we didn't like was the steamed chocolate cake with mint ice creama group of the 4 of us did not want to finish this dessert! aspect: dessert

Includes a diverse array of entrees ranging from Boar (prepared in your choice of either the French or Asian tradition), Mussels, or Pad Thai that grace the menu all at once, each one prepared in a distinctly different and delicate sauce. aspect: Mussels
My only advice is: increase portion sizes; and develop a special drink list. aspect: drink list

If you like an ecclectic crowd and an overall good time where you and your friends can get together whether it be to eat, drink or just play some good old pictionary (they provide crayons and a blank white sheet at every table), go to the Cargo! aspect: sheet

My ceasar salad amounted to some limp lettuce and mayo strewn around a large plate, and the only way I might have died for the mac and cheese is due to natural causes while waiting for it to arrive. aspect: ceasar salad
The waitress never came back to get drink refills and we didn't get water until we were halfway through our dinner. aspect: dinner
Ten minutes later the manager relented and dropped off a glass of water with an upturned nose. aspect: glass of water
While dining on a delicate lamb carpaccio, and grilled skate wing, the owner explained that due to low lunch-time patronage, they may be discontinuing lunch altogether. aspect: owner
The bartender, the wait staff and management all put the customer first and that was clear and much appreciated. aspect: wait staff
Maybe I've just gotten lucky with seating, but I've never had more than a ten minute wait. aspect: seating
It was not the mistake of the frozen lasagna, it was the icy service of the manager which has spoiled this restaurant for me. aspect: manager

The brasserie-style menu remains relatively unchanged, featuring classic bistro choices like frisee salad with bacon, blue cheese and a poached egg, steak tartare, moules and steak frites, and various burgers and sandwiches. aspect: bistro choices

The place was packed and while our food took time to be prepared, our waiter earned points for his sparkling conversation to pass time and for also knowing practically every ingredient of every special under consideration. aspect: food
I've only been in a few times for brunch as it does get quite busy, it's worth it though especially now that they have those amazing Blueberry Waffles. aspect: Blueberry Waffles
The staff were rude and rushed us through our meal, clearing plates and laying down dessert menus while others were still eating their main courses. aspect: main courses
Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: prices
Been there a few times for dinner, brunch or just a drink (the French cosmos are fantastic) and it just keeps getting better. aspect: drink

The hostess was condescending and the waiter was somewhat absent and unaccomodating (sure, we made a reservation to sit outside but when I asked to be moved indoors after I heard thunder he didn't even try to make it happen, giving me a blank stare and a shrug when I asked what we would do if it rained). aspect: reservation
Downtown Dinner 2002 - Prixe fix: Appetizers were ok, waiter gave me poor suggestion. aspect: Appetizers
Anyway, I went down on a Wednesday night to see if they had a long wait and the hostess said they had a table to accomodate my party. aspect: table
My vegetable Napoleon was good; although i first got the veggie burger because the waitress mis-heard and stood my friend up for another 15 minutes of waiting to have it served. aspect: waiting
No matter what, you should expect a wait, big deal, small price to pay for great food as far as I'm concerned. aspect: food
yes this place has good pizza but HORRIFIC HORRIFIC delivery service. aspect: pizza
But on a recent Sunday brunch excursion, I was greeted by a uniformly unfriendly staff - starting with the hostess and extending to foul faced wait staff. aspect: hostess

With all of the kitchen goof-ups (appetizer coming out before the entree and one entree coming out ten minutes before the other) you would think that the wait staff would have been more attentive. aspect: appetizer
Sometimes I grow a bit weary of dining in those pretentious, haughty taughty, high fashion eateries. aspect: eateries
The only drawback was slow service, but the food and ambience are so nice that your wait is A) pleasant and B) worth it. aspect: service
Everything from the food to the service was enjoyable about this place, but I can't recommend the tempura shrimp roll with the lobster salad enough. aspect: service
The food was served in small portions and my lamb was pure fat. aspect: lamb
Rich appetizers (baked fontina, lentil cake, french onion soup) and ample, tasty salads. aspect: appetizers
If people are late, you could lose your reservation and/or the staff does pressure you to start ordering even if your whole party hasnt arrived. aspect: staff
The waiter seemed astounded that I ordered no wine or alcohol -- just water -- with my meal. aspect: meal
Ive had better burgers and fries at the local dinner in my neighborhood: 3 guys dinner on 96th and Madison Avenue. aspect: local dinner
I was at Son Cubano a few months ago, and although i was only at the bar (without prior reservations which are a must), i had an awesome time. aspect: bar
The meat, onions, and cheese were good as was the roll, but I'd go back if I could forego the sauce. aspect: cheese

While the staff was kind and attentive, our waiter never once broke a smile, even when I told him it was my friend's birthday, although he did bring a dessert with a candle at the end of the meal. aspect: candle
service was attentive at the beginning but the waiter lost us towards the end and we had to flag them down for the check. aspect: service
Half the menu is comprised of original creations while the other half consists of unique slants on orthodox cuisine such as the single super-sized gnocchi with cinammon. aspect: gnocchi

The Food The versatile Austrian menu, fused with French and American, rewards both high and low-end appetites: rich, cheese-laden onion soup, grilled Gruyere and country ham sandwiches and big-bunned burgers are as satisfying as velvety liver terrine with kumquat-cranberry compote, speck and sausage charcuterie and inexpensive cheese plates. aspect: liver terrine

Amusing details distinguish desserts, from dulce de leche ice-cream profiteroles dotting a chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe board, to coconut custard surrounded by a sea of Malibu-rum gelee and poached pineapple. aspect: chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe
The service was great, the chef even gave me a complimentary dish. aspect: service
The waitress forgot our coffee, took forever to take our order, never checked in with us after the food came and when we were done, didn't bring us the check for the longest time. aspect: coffee
Food was average, the appetizers were better than the main courses. aspect: main courses
The food was served promptly and was really hot. aspect: food
To both our surprise, this inquiry was interpreted as a personal offense by the waiter who told my wife to leave the store if she didnt want the pastries. aspect: waiter

From beginning appetizers, the scallops were incredible, to the delicious chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet, we were delighted by the taste sensations. aspect: chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet
The food was great so that made up for the lack of service from the waitress. aspect: food
The Food The menu features a wide array of Hawaiian- and Asian-flavored appetizers and entrees. aspect: appetizers
The food is delish, you just have to know the manners to consume, if you don't want to be frustrated with the service. aspect: service
My party felt like we got put in a dining room for tourist, which must have been the penalty box area for the disgruntled wait staff on duty. aspect: wait staff
then the manager gave us lemon juice instead of ceasar dressing for a ceasar salad which ruined the salad. aspect: manager
The service was non-existant, the manager spent all of his time at the bar. aspect: manager
(Though the filet won't be enough if both have hearty apitites. aspect: filet
yes this place has good pizza but HORRIFIC HORRIFIC delivery service. aspect: service
The server was so busy the night we visited that she forgot to put in our food order. aspect: server
It's sad that everything about this place was great (even the service and decor) except for the steak. aspect: service
However, it takes ages to get seated (even with a reservation), and the waiters don't seem very knowledgeable about the menu (or receptive to questions). aspect: waiters
Went to celebrate my sisters birthday on 9/11 was 1st taken back on the waiters rude answering of a question we had about the menu. aspect: menu
The smoked salmon appetizer was pretty good (it comes with goat cheese, calpers and onions). aspect: onions
The only apparent flavor in any of the dishes was heat, and a table of four gourmands left at least half of our meals on our plates. aspect: meals
The waitress never came back to get drink refills and we didn't get water until we were halfway through our dinner. aspect: waitress
Not a destination restaurant, but if you're hungry for breakfast or lunch, big portions and good quality for the money. aspect: quality

Amusing details distinguish desserts, from dulce de leche ice-cream profiteroles dotting a chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe board, to coconut custard surrounded by a sea of Malibu-rum gelee and poached pineapple. aspect: desserts
They crumbed the table once, although it was solied the entire meal. aspect: meal
The Black Duck is a great date place, whether going for dinner or just for a drink at their huge, antique-ish bar. aspect: Black Duck
got the guac but no drinks until it was all gone (approximately 20 minutes later). aspect: guac
When my (pregnant) friend asked about a non-alcoholic version of a drink, the answer was simply no, with no further suggestions. aspect: drink

Our spastic waiter was running around like a chicken with his head cut off, and, thus, slow to take our order, slow to bring us our drinks (they sat on the bar for 5-10 minutes) and slow to get us the water we had to ask for repeatedly. aspect: waiter

In Short The vegi burgers (and the full bar) are the main draws: ranging from the Super Veg-Burger with lettuce, tomato and Abijah's secret sauce to the McKate (two un-beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, dairy or nondairy cheese, etc. aspect: Abijah's secret sauce

Ok I got the edamame and something from the sushi chef for free, but the quality of food is more important to me than a free small dish (maybe that's why the restaurant gives it to attact new customers. aspect: quality of food
They are negligent in alerting customers when an order is ready - you could end up waiting for half an hour while your food is sitting on their counter getting cold. aspect: food
I told the waiter that my drink tasted very bad and asked if he could swap it out for a Petron Margarita. aspect: drink
I would have told the wait staff if anyone had asked me if I enjoyed my meal, but no one asked. aspect: wait staff
The portions are small but being that the food was so good makes up for that. aspect: portions
I'm totally into the space-age vibe of this place, but I wish they had more tables to sit down at. aspect: tables
The Food Regulars swear by the tamales, which are spongy, well-seasoned and pulled from steaming crocks on the counter. aspect: Food
The waiter kept coming up and asking to take our plates while we were still eating and the manager stood and stared at us through half our meal! aspect: waiter
The waiter seemed astounded that I ordered no wine or alcohol -- just water -- with my meal. aspect: waiter

For example, we had ordered a 2nd bottle of red wine, the waitress gave me a new glass to taste the wine, but filled up my existing glass (mixing two different bottles in one glass). aspect: bottle of red wine
The manager apologized and gave us back $20 for the difference, BUT THE WAITER NEVER RETURNED THE $120 CASH WE PAID. aspect: WAITER
There is nothing else on the menu except for exotic teas and cold beverages, but with a meal this cheap and delightful, who would care? aspect: meal
Our waiter was not attentive, we waited about 20 mins just to order drinks. aspect: waiter
A friend of mine and I bumped into this restaurant last week and it didn't look like any special place on the outside, but when we looked at the menu we decided to give it a try. aspect: menu

to be honest we only had drinks and appetizers downstairs as we were there for a collegues leaving drinks but the staff was very friendly (typical aussies) and the food i did have was pretty darn good. aspect: staff

The Food Consulting Chef Douglas Rodriguez's forte is blending the diversity of traditional Latin cuisine with modern culinary chic: A celery sorbet cools the spicy-citrus bite of lobster; shrimp seviche and crunchy green plantains coat thick, juicy halibut resting on sweet plantain hash; and tart tomato escabeche moistens a chewy skirt steak. aspect: halibut resting

We were directed to a table by a member of staff, which we were then informed was reserved, and lost our seats at the bar, all this after spending upwards of $30 each on very expensive drinks over a two-hour period. aspect: staff
The old menu items are gone, except for the rib appetizer, which is now bland and fatty, with little trace of the excellent mustard sauce. aspect: rib appetizer

The brasserie-style menu remains relatively unchanged, featuring classic bistro choices like frisee salad with bacon, blue cheese and a poached egg, steak tartare, moules and steak frites, and various burgers and sandwiches. aspect: steak frites
I live about a 1/2 block from Westway and when I want consistantly good food, big portions, great fast service and a step above your average diner food I go there! aspect: diner food
